intro: Clidemia solearis, commonly known as the silverleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its velvety, silver-green leaves and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Clidemia solearis is also known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal.
